text.section: A telephone company or reseller may not fail or neglect to comply with this subtitle or with a regulation adopted under this subtitle.

For the purpose of enforcing the provisions of this subtitle, the Commission may:
exercise any of the powers conferred under this division against a telephone company or reseller; and
in the case of a complaint filed against a telephone company or reseller, order the telephone company or reseller to make reparations to the complaining party in accordance with § 8-405 of this subtitle.

In addition to any other available penalty, the Commission may assess directly, after an opportunity for hearing, an administrative penalty on a telephone company or reseller that violates the provisions of this subtitle, or a regulation adopted under this subtitle, or federal law or regulation on unauthorized changes to a customer's telephone company, reseller, or telecommunications service options, or to the person who bills the customer or the customer's billing arrangement.
The administrative penalty assessed under this section may not exceed $1,000 for each violation associated with a specific access line in the State.
An administrative penalty collected under this section shall be paid into the General Fund of the State.
